bibl.title: Basalt as Ships' Ballast and the Roman Incense Trade. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: The ships' ballast from Quseir al-Qadim and Berenike, analysed chemically, came probably from Qana' and Aden in Yemen. Two pieces of obsidian from Quseir may have been acquired through trade with Adulis.

bibl.title: Food for the Gods. New Light on the Ancient Incense Trade

bibl.seg: PEACOCK David, David WILLIAMS and Sarah JAMES, Basalt as Ships' Ballast and the Roman Incense Trade. Avec résumé en anglais.
David PEACOCK and David WILLIAMS (Edd.), Food for the Gods. New Light on the Ancient Incense Trade (Oxford, 2007) pp. 28-70, 14 graphiques, 5 cartes.

The ships' ballast from Quseir al-Qadim and Berenike, analysed chemically, came probably from Qana' and Aden in Yemen. Two pieces of obsidian from Quseir may have been acquired through trade with Adulis.
